title: @RIOT PUNISHMENT DECAY.
body:
Since RIot's Support team cant realy answer my question i guess i have to somehow get the attention from someone at riot.
1stly,whats the point of the riot support team since 99% of them are bots,i ask about the punishment decay system and the bot gives me a copy paste response on how to avoid getting banned,i mean i waited almost 2 weeks for a response by a bot how is that even rational?.
2ndly,this is the second thread i am making on the subject,can i get someone at riot to explain how the punishment decay works?
You would expect a company with a player support team and boards full of moderators to be able to answer this but this is some steam level customer support.

replies.body:
Maybe it was because your question is unclear.

For behavior, its 3 months of being active, without being punished to drop a tier.
For Hextech rewards, it varies based on punishment and how much you are getting reported.
For leaver buster, its about the number of games you play without getting DCed. 

Most the time, there isn't a set number, cos Riot wants you to fully reform instead of faking it for a set number of games.
A lot of newer information suggests that the 3-month thing changed to a system similar (but not connected to) Hextech eligibility, where you only drop by playing games and showing reform.

I do suspect that, but I haven't seen a source yet.

Care to send one to me? or maybe send it in internal banter?

You didn't get a specific answer because there isn't one. Be a sportsmanlike player and you don't have to worry about being punished, and over time your tier will diminish naturally. Playing games and showing reform is the only way to lower it.

everyone has bad games,riot only needs 3,i cant imagine someone being on the 14 day ban and after it reforming then one day having 3-4 bad games 5 months later and getting perma banned.That doesnt feel right to me.

You are only provided 3 examples, but that is not the requirement to get punished. It typically takes a lot more than that to trigger a review and punishment (though immediately coming off one punishment you'll be on very thin ice). The more games you play without being negative the farther you get from that. If you play regularly for 5 months showing you've actually reformed there is very little chance that a few bad games will ruin it.

If the system sees you as reformed or in the process of reforming adequately then it drops you punishment tiers. You won't know when it happens. Just don't break the summoner's code and you won't have to worry about it.
